Class Dolphin

  • java.lang.Object
    • Dolphin

  • public class Dolphin
extends java.lang.Object
    Dolphin class. It represents the dolphin in the game
    Version:
    5.0.0 06.09.2015 Updated Time Spent as of June 9, 2015: 5.5 Hours -playing with physics of dolphin and edge detection
    Author:
    Jordan Levy

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dolphin

        public Dolphin(double x,
               double y)
        Dolphin constructor creates a Dolphin object and initializes global variables.

        Local variables:

        e IOException caught for reading images from files

        Try Catch blocks:

        1st Try Catch used to catch if the image isn't found so the program does not crash.

        Parameters:
        x - double x position of the dolphin
        y - double y position of the dolphin

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves the dolphin using physics. The dolphin's distanceX is increased, and it is given an accelerationY based on its position, as well as the space key. Its velocityY is set based on accelerationY and deltaT, and friction is applied. y is set. angle is set. fractionWayDown is set. If the dolphin is below the soft floor, angle is set using fractionWayDown so that collision with the ground is smooth. If the dolphin is below the floor, y is set to be at floor height, angle is 0, accelerationY is 0, and so is velocityY. Hitbox positions of the dolphin and the net are set based on the angle. The images of the dolphin and the net are rotated by angle.

        Local variables:

        fractionWayDown double fraction representation of how far below the soft floor the dolphin is.

        Conditional Statements:

        1st conditional statement used to alter the acceleration to increase so it jumps quicker than it dives.

        2nd conditional statement used to alter the acceleration to increase when the user clicks the space bar (manual dive).

        3rd conditional statement used to rotate the dolphin when it is near the bottom so it does not hit

        1st conditional statement in 3rd conditional statement used to reset the dolphin to the bottom if it is one pixel past so it resets to the value of the bottom
